choices.name: Get started with research for your New Hampshire ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for New Hampshire ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for New Hampshire research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic New Hampshire research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic New Hampshire Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ AA—New Hampshire Genealogy

  2. Follow this research study for New Hampshire ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step New Hampshire Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for New Hampshire research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—New Hampshire Resources
    ☆ AC—New Hampshire State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the New Hampshire Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—New Hampshire Record Selection Table

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial New Hampshire.

      ☆ AC—Colonial New Hampshire

    5. Follow this case study for New Hampshire research.

      ☆ LDS—Finding a New Hampshire man's parents without a birth record


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in New Hampshire in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for New Hampshire

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—New Hampshire African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for New Hampshire.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in New Hampshire in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of New Hampshire


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about research in colonial New Hampshire.

    ☆ AC—Colonial New Hampshire

  5. Follow this case study for New Hampshire research.

    ☆ LDS—Finding a New Hampshire man's parents without a birth record

Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in New Hampshire in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for New Hampshire

  2. Learn more about African American records.

    ☆ AG—New Hampshire African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for New Hampshire.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in New Hampshire in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of New Hampshire

hidden.content:

  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or New Hampshire County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for New Hampshire.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the New Hampshire Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the New_Hampshire Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the New Hampshire Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. Northeast Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for New Hampshire.

Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about New Hampshire research.
  2. Explore the New Hampshire research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about New Hampshire research.

choices.name: Learn about New Hampshire genealogy societies.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

1. Learn about genealogy societies in New Hampshire in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New Hampshire Societies

  2. Explore the New Hampshire Society of Genealogists site.
  3. Explore the New Hampshire Historical Society site.
  4. Explore New Hampshire genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in New Hampshire.
